member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.AppBroadcastTrigger
member.summary: Represents an event that triggers a background task to run when an application starts gameplay broadcasting.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.AppBroadcastTrigger.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an AppBroadcastTrigger with the name of the provider that will be doing the gameplay broadcasting.
member.param: The name of the provider that is broadcasting gameplay.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.AppBroadcastTrigger.ProviderInfo
member.summary: Provides information about the application that is broadcasting gameplay.
member.returns: Information about the provider that is broadcasting gameplay, such as the maximum video bitrate, height and width of the video, etc.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.AppBroadcastTriggerProviderInfo
member.summary: Provides information about the application that is broadcasting gameplay such as its logo, display name, and video characteristics.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.AppBroadcastTriggerProviderInfo.DisplayNameResource
member.summary: Gets and sets the resource location for the UI friendly name of the provider that is broadcasting gameplay.
member.returns: The resource location of the display name. For example, "ms-resource://resources/DisplayName"

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.AppBroadcastTriggerProviderInfo.LogoResource
member.summary: Gets and sets the resource location of the logo of the provider that is broadcasting gameplay.
member.returns: The resource location of the logo. For example, "ms-resource://resources/Logo.png"

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.AppBroadcastTriggerProviderInfo.MaxVideoBitrate
member.summary: Gets and sets the maximum bitrate that the provider that is broadcasting gameplay can provide.
member.returns: The maximum bitrate in bits per second. For example, 2500000 = 2.5 mbps

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.AppBroadcastTriggerProviderInfo.MaxVideoHeight
member.summary: Gets and sets the maximum video height that the gameplay broadcast provider supports.
member.returns: Maximum video height in pixels.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.AppBroadcastTriggerProviderInfo.MaxVideoWidth
member.summary: Gets and sets the maximum video width that the gameplay broadcast provider supports.
member.returns: Maximum video width in pixels.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Background.AppBroadcastTriggerProviderInfo.VideoKeyFrameInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the amount of time between video key frames.
member.returns: The time span between key frames.

member.name: T:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService
member.summary: Provides an interface between the broadcasting UWP app and the system-hosted broadcast service. This class provides access to objects that facilitate broadcast service authentication, test the bandwidth capabilities of the device's internet to the broadcasting provider service, and allow your task to acquire captured audio and video frames so that they can be sent to the broadcast provider service.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.AppId
member.summary: Gets a string containing an identifier for the game being broadcast. When broadcasting on a desktop device, this value is the game on which the user initiated broadcasting.
member.returns: A string containing a system-defined identifier for the broadcasting app.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.BroadcastChannel
member.summary: Gets a string containing the name of the current broadcast channel.
member.returns: A string containing the name of the current broadcast channel.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.BroadcastLanguage
member.summary: Gets a string representing the language of the current broadcast channel.
member.returns: A string representing the language of the current broadcast channel.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.BroadcastTitle
member.summary: Gets a string containing the user-specified title of the broadcast.
member.returns: A string containing the user-specified title of the broadcast.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.PlugInState
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying the current state of the broadcast background task.
member.returns: A value specifying the current state of the broadcast background task.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.SignInInfo
member.summary: Gets an object that represents the sign-in information for the app broadcast background service.
member.returns: An object that represents the sign-in information for the app broadcast background service.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.StreamInfo
member.summary: Gets an object that manages the stream state of the app broadcast background service.
member.returns: An object that manages the stream state of the app broadcast background service.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.TitleId
member.summary: Gets a unique identifier for the title being broadcast.
member.returns: A unique identifier for the title being broadcast.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.ViewerCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of viewers of the broadcast.
member.returns: The number of viewers of the broadcast.

member.name: E:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.BroadcastChannelChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the value of the BroadcastChannel property changes.

member.name: E:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.BroadcastLanguageChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the value of the BroadcastLanguage property changes.

member.name: E:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.BroadcastTitleChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the value of the BroadcastTitle property changes.

member.name: E:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.HeartbeatRequested
member.summary: Raised by the system periodically to confirm that the broadcasting background task is currently active.

member.name: M:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastBackgroundService.TerminateBroadcast(Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastTerminationReason,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Terminates a broadcast.
member.param: A value indicating the reason that the broadcast is being terminated.
An integer that conveys a provider-specific reason that the broadcast is being terminated.

member.summary: Occurs when the sign-in state of the app broadcast background service changes.

member.summary: Occurs when the UserName property changes.

member.summary: Occurs when the app broadcast video encoding resolution changes.

member.summary: Notifies the system that a problem with the broadcast stream has been detected.

member.summary: The broadcast was exited because of an authentication failure.

member.summary: The broadcast was exited because a foreground app was activated.

member.summary: The broadcast was exited normally.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastExitBroadcastModeReason.UserCanceled
member.summary: The user canceled the broadcast.

member.name: T:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings
member.summary: Specifies global broadcasting settings that persist across all broadcasting UWP apps.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.CameraOverlayLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the location of the camera overlay within the broadcast video frame.
member.returns: A value that specifies the location of the camera overlay within the broadcast video frame.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.CameraOverlaySize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the size of the camera overlay within the broadcast video frame.
member.returns: A value that specifies the size of the camera overlay within the broadcast video frame.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.HasHardwareEncoder
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current device supports hardware-based media encoding.
member.returns: True if the device supports hardware encoding; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.IsAudioCaptureEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether audio capture is enabled for broadcasting.
member.returns: True if audio capture is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.IsBroadcastEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if broadcasting is enabled on the device.
member.returns: True if broadcasting is enabled on the device; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.IsCameraCaptureEnabledByDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether camera capture for broadcasting is enabled by default.
member.returns: True if camera capture is enabled by default; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.IsCursorImageCaptureEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the cursor image is captured.
member.returns: True if the cursor image is captured; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.IsDisabledByPolicy
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if broadcasting is disabled on the device by group policy.
member.returns: True if broadcasting is disabled on the device by group policy; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.IsEchoCancellationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether echo cancellation is enabled.
member.returns: True if echo cancellation is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.IsGpuConstrained
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the GPU on the device is constrained.
member.returns: True if the GPU is constrained; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.IsMicrophoneCaptureEnabledByDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether microphone capture for broadcasting is enabled by default.
member.returns: True if microphone capture is enabled by default; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.MicrophoneGain
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the microphone gain for broadcast audio capture.
member.returns: The microphone gain for broadcast audio capture.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.SelectedCameraId
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the device ID of the camera used for broadcast video capture.
member.returns: The device ID of the camera used for broadcast video capture.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastGlobalSettings.SystemAudioGain
member.summary: Gets or sets the system gain for broadcast audio capture.
member.returns: The system gain for broadcast audio capture.

member.name: T:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastHeartbeatRequestedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the AppBroadcastBackgroundService.HeartbeatRequested event which is raised by the system periodically to confirm that the broadcasting background task is currently active.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastHeartbeatRequestedEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the broadcasting background task is currently active.
member.returns: True if the broadcasting background task is currently active; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastPlugInState
member.summary: Specifies the current state of the broadcast background task.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastPlugInState.InBandwidthTest
member.summary: The broadcast background task is in the process of testing the bandwidth of the device's connection to the broadcasting service provider. Once this test is complete, the system will set the AppBroadcastBackgroundServiceStreamInfo.BandwidthTestBitrate property to indicate the result of the bandwidth test.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastPlugInState.Initialized
member.summary: The broadcast background task is initialized.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastPlugInState.MicrosoftSignInRequired
member.summary: The current user needs to be authenticated with the Microsoft service.

member.summary: The current user needs to be authenticated with the broadcast provider service.

member.summary: The broadcast background task needs to authenticate the current user with the broadcast provider service.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastPlugInState.ReadyToBroadcast
member.summary: The broadcast background task is ready to broadcast.

member.name: T:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamAudioFrame
member.summary: Represents a frame of audio samples in a broadcast stream.

member.summary: Gets the buffer containing the audio samples for the broadcast audio frame.
member.returns: The buffer containing the audio samples for the broadcast audio frame.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamAudioFrame.AudioHeader
member.summary: Gets an object that contains metadata about the associated broadcast audio frame.
member.returns: An object that contains metadata about the associated broadcast audio frame.

member.summary: Provides metadata about a broadcast audio frame.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamAudioHeader.AbsoluteTimestamp
member.summary: Gets a time stamp indicating the system time at which the audio frame was captured.
member.returns: A time stamp indicating the system time at which the audio frame was captured.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamAudioHeader.Duration
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the duration of the audio frame.
member.returns: The duration of the audio frame.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamAudioHeader.FrameId
member.summary: Gets a value that identifies the audio frame.
member.returns: A value that identifies the audio frame.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamAudioHeader.HasDiscontinuity
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the audio frame contains a discontinuity in the audio stream.
member.returns: True if the audio frame contains a discontinuity; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamAudioHeader.RelativeTimestamp
member.summary: Gets a time stamp indicating the relative time within the audio stream at which the audio frame was captured.
member.returns: A time stamp indicating the relative time within the audio stream at which the audio frame was captured.

member.name: T:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamReader
member.summary: Provides methods and events for obtaining audio and video frames from an app broadcast stream.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamReader.AudioAacSequence
member.summary: Gets a buffer containing the sequence header for the AAC audio stream.
member.returns: A buffer containing the sequence header for the AAC audio stream.

member.summary: Gets the bitrate of the audio stream associated with the AppBroadcastStreamReader, in bits per second.
member.returns: The bitrate of the audio stream, in bits per second.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamReader.AudioChannels
member.summary: Gets the number of channels in the audio stream associated with the AppBroadcastStreamReader.
member.returns: The number of channels in the audio stream.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamReader.AudioSampleRate
member.summary: Gets the sample rate of the audio stream associated with the AppBroadcastStreamReader.
member.returns: The sample rate of the audio stream

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamReader.VideoBitrate
member.summary: Gets the bitrate of the video stream associated with the AppBroadcastStreamReader, in bits per second.
member.returns: The bitrate of the video stream, in bits per second.

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamReader.VideoHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the frames in the video stream associated with the AppBroadcastStreamReader.
member.returns: The height of the frames in the video stream

member.name: P:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamReader.VideoWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the frames in the video stream associated with the AppBroadcastStreamReader.
member.returns: The width of the frames in the video stream

member.name: E:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamReader.AudioFrameArrived
member.summary: Raised when a new audio frame from the broadcast stream arrives.

member.name: E:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamReader.VideoFrameArrived
member.summary: Raised when a new video frame from the broadcast stream arrives.

member.name: M:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamReader.TryGetNextAudioFrame
member.summary: Attempts to obtain an AppBroadcastStreamAudioFrame object representing the latest audio frame from the broadcast stream.
member.returns: If successful, the latest audio frame from the broadcast stream; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastStreamReader.TryGetNextVideoFrame
member.summary: Attempts to obtain an AppBroadcastStreamVideoFrame object representing the latest video frame from the broadcast stream.
member.returns: If successful, the latest video frame from the broadcast stream; otherwise, null.

member.name: T:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastTerminationReason
member.summary: Specifies the reason that an app broadcast was terminated.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastTerminationReason.BackgroundTaskTerminated
member.summary: The app broadcast was terminated because the app broadcast background task was terminated.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastTerminationReason.BackgroundTaskUnresponsive
member.summary: The app broadcast was terminated because the app broadcast background task was unresponsive.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastTerminationReason.InternalError
member.summary: The app broadcast was terminated because of an internal error.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastTerminationReason.LostConnectionToService
member.summary: The app broadcast was terminated because the connection to the service was lost.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastTerminationReason.NoNetworkConnectivity
member.summary: The app broadcast was terminated because there is no network connectivity.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastTerminationReason.NormalTermination
member.summary: The app broadcast was terminated because it was terminated normally.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastTerminationReason.ServiceAbort
member.summary: The app broadcast was terminated because the service aborted the broadcast.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastTerminationReason.ServiceError
member.summary: The app broadcast was terminated because there was a service error.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastTerminationReason.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: The app broadcast was terminated because the service was unavailable.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastTerminationReason.UnsupportedFormat
member.summary: The app broadcast was terminated because it uses an unsupported format.

member.name: T:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastVideoEncodingBitrateMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode for setting the bitrate for broadcast video encoding.

member.summary: The bitrate is set automatically by the system.

member.name: T:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastVideoEncodingResolutionMode

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastVideoEncodingResolutionMode.Auto
member.summary: The resolution is set automatically by the system.

member.name: F:Windows.Media.Capture.AppBroadcastVideoEncodingResolutionMode.Custom
member.summary: The resolution specified with the AppBroadcastProviderSettings.CustomVideoEncodingHeight and CustomVideoEncodingBitrate properties is used.
